value.title: Using RELATED and RELATEDTABLE in DAX
value.excerpt: Why and when to use RELATED and its companion function RELATEDTABLE: two common DAX functions that are required when using a row context with relationships. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751669?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Using variables in DAX makes the code easier to read, faster, and easier to debug. Learn how and when to use variables, along with why they are so important in any DAX expression. Article and download: https://sql.bi/760161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Distribute Power BI insights
value.excerpt: Distribute Power BI insights

topItems.title: Publish and share in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Publish and share your Power BI reports and dashboards to teammates in your organization or to everyone on the web.

topItems.title: Explore data in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Turn your business intelligence data into data insights by creating and configuring Power BI dashboards.

value.title: Add measures to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to work with implicit and explicit measures. You'll start by creating simple measures, which summarize a single column or table. Then, you'll create more complex measures based on other measures in the model. Additionally, you'll learn about the similarities of, and differences between, a calculated column and a measure.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Publish and share in Power BI
value.excerpt: Publish and share your Power BI reports and dashboards to teammates in your organization or to everyone on the web.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #118: Get selected or multiple values from slicers using DAX
value.excerpt: In today's #daxfridays video I will show you how to get selected or multiple values from a slicer.  To do that, we will use the following functiions: 1. SELECTEDVALUE: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/selectedvalue-dax 2. ALLSELECTED: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/allselected-dax 3. IN: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/in-dax

value.title: Get only the rows you need in Power Query from your files.
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to find the rows you need and import those instead of importing everything and then filtering them.
